title: OmegaStarScream
author: OmegaStarScream
content: I didn't see any posts about this, so thought I'd share:Quote from: https://twitter.com/COLDCARDwallet/status/1591183585759105024Get 15% off COLDCARD with promo code FCKFTX for the next 24hrs, pay with bitcoin for an extra 5% off!Get your #Bitcoin off exchanges. NOW.Self Custody. No excuses.https://store.coinkite.com/promo/FCKFTXThe offer ends in less than 10 hours and for the 5% off when using bitcoin, use the code: CKBTC.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Just saw that on twitter.I thought there used to be an annual post someplace on the board about black Friday / Christmas discounts on hardware wallets and things.Might be worth having a general, heavily moderated discount code post just to keep up all the time now. Eliminating the current disaster discounts do seem to be popping up more and more with conferences / events and so on happening all over. Not everyone is going to be looking at every tweet or facebook post from every company but having a moderated list might not be the worst idea.-Dave

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on November 12, 2022, 11:45:25 AMThe offer ends in less than 10 hours and for the 5% off when using bitcoin, use the code: CKBTC.Really nice move from Coldcard with this discount, thanks to debacle of FTX exchange, and we can say that something good can always be found in bad situations.Few other hardware wallet manufacturers are also following this trend with their own discounts, and this became like early Black Friday and Cyber Monday Satochip is currently offering 20% discount with promo code FUFTX20, and CoolWallet have 15% discount until November 15 for their hardware wallets.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: For hardware wallet manufacturers the FTX debacle might be the biggest boost in business that they will ever experience. The good thing is that the community will profit if this, since more volume means cheaper prices and more money for innovation in that market.

comments.author: nvK
comments.body: Quote from: hZti on November 26, 2022, 10:34:17 AMFor hardware wallet manufacturers the FTX debacle might be the biggest boost in business that they will ever experience. The good thing is that the community will profit if this, since more volume means cheaper prices and more money for innovation in that market.It was indeed quite the high demand, really amazing to see how much bitcoin left the exchanges these last few weeks.
